index.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: an alphabetical list of names, subjects etc at the back of a book, with the numbers of the pages where they can be found
index.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a set of cards or a database containing information, usually arranged in alphabetical order and used especially in a library
index.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a standard by which the level of something can be judged or measured
index.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: The changing size of an infant’s head is considered an index of brain growth.
index.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: a system by which prices, costs etc can be compared to those of a previous date
index.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: if documents, information etc are indexed, an index is made for them
index.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The reports are indexed by subject and location.
index.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to arrange for the level of wages, pensions etc to increase or decrease according to the level of prices
index.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: demands that wages be indexed to the rise in prices
index.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: something such as a price, amount, level etc that shows the general level of related prices etc
index.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: The price of gold bullion on the exchange remains a sensitive index of confidence in the international market.
index.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: a figure showing the level of something, for example prices, in relation to earlier levels. Indexes often use the figure 100 as the BASE in a particular year and figures for later years are given in relation to this base
index.translation[2].definitions[2].defi: an official list of the average price of shares in a group of companies on a particular stockmarket
index.translation[2].definitions[2].exam: Milan’s Stock Index fell 2% in the year.
index.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: to arrange for the level of payments such as wages or PENSIONs to go up at the same rate as something else, usually prices
index.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: Tax exemptions should be indexed to the purchasing power of the pound.
index.translation[3].definitions[1].defi: if an investment is indexed to something, for example a currency or a STOCK INDEX,  its value rises and falls in relation to the currency etc
index.translation[3].definitions[1].exam: The yield of Ukrainian treasury bills is indexed to the value of the local currency, the hryvnia, in terms of the dollar.
